I’m also cosponsoring amendments to end the ban on Medicare drug price negotiation entirely and to make sure people paying out-of-pocket are also eligible to get the discounted prices from this bill. The uninsured shouldn’t be left out. 5

This bill is a step in the right direction but it’s not perfect. That’s why I’ve offered an amendment to guarantee price negotiation on ALL life-sustaining Rx. The bill requires negotiation for as few as 25 drugs to start which means some life-sustaining meds could be missed. 4

This could get the total cost of a breast cancer drug like Ibrance down from $69000 to $23900 annually. Another example: diabetes patients could spend 3.5x less on insulin under the bill than before. Some common types of insulin may drop to as low as $400/year. 3

For the first time Medicare will negotiate on prices to get a better deal for patients for some drugs. People with private health insurance will benefit too because the negotiated discounts will also apply to drugs on the private market. 2

This week we’ll vote on H.R. 3 the Lower Drug Costs Now Act to help patients afford their Rx. Savings in the bill will be used to cap out-of-pocket drug spending for Medicare patients at $2K/year and create new dental hearing and vision benefits under Medicare. 1
